body_html:
I guess I can't really deal with this since Graphs are considered append-only? As per http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34235225/is-it-possible-to-modify-an-existing-tensorflow-computation-graph

I did find some information on how to copy graphs: https://codesachin.wordpress.com/2015/11/20/recursively-copying-elements-from-one-graph-to-another-in-tensorflow/ but that seems like it's liable to break since it's digging into the graph internals...
body_text:
I guess I can't really deal with this since Graphs are considered append-only? As per http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34235225/is-it-possible-to-modify-an-existing-tensorflow-computation-graph
I did find some information on how to copy graphs: https://codesachin.wordpress.com/2015/11/20/recursively-copying-elements-from-one-graph-to-another-in-tensorflow/ but that seems like it's liable to break since it's digging into the graph internals...
body:
I guess I can't really deal with this since Graphs are considered append-only? As per http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34235225/is-it-possible-to-modify-an-existing-tensorflow-computation-graph

I did find some information on how to copy graphs: https://codesachin.wordpress.com/2015/11/20/recursively-copying-elements-from-one-graph-to-another-in-tensorflow/ but that seems like it's liable to break since it's digging into the graph internals...
